name: List
title: Google
Cloud
Spanner
Instance
Config
List
description: Instance::Config::List is a special case Array with additional values.

methods.name: token
title: Google
Cloud
Spanner
Instance
Config
List#token
methods.description: If not empty, indicates that there are more records that match the request and this value should be passed to continue.

methods.name: token=
title: Google
Cloud
Spanner
Instance
Config
List#token=
methods.description: If not empty, indicates that there are more records that match the request and this value should be passed to continue.

methods.name: next?
title: Google
Cloud
Spanner
Instance
Config
List#next?
methods.description: Whether there is a next page of instance configs.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/spanner"

spanner = Google::Cloud::Spanner.new

configs = spanner.instance_configs
if configs.next?
  next_configs = configs.next
end

methods.name: next
title: Google
Cloud
Spanner
Instance
Config
List#next
methods.description: Retrieve the next page of instance configs.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/spanner"

spanner = Google::Cloud::Spanner.new

configs = spanner.instance_configs
if configs.next?
  next_configs = configs.next
end

methods.name: all
title: Google
Cloud
Spanner
Instance
Config
List#all
methods.description:
Retrieves all configs by repeatedly loading #next until #next? returns false. Calls the given block once for each instance config, which is passed as the parameter.

An Enumerator is returned if no block is given.

This method may make several API calls until all configs are retrieved. Be sure to use as narrow a search criteria as possible. Please use with caution.

examples.caption: Iterating each instance config by passing a block:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/spanner"

spanner = Google::Cloud::Spanner.new

spanner.instance_configs.all do |config|
  puts config.name
end

examples.caption: Using the enumerator by not passing a block:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/spanner"

spanner = Google::Cloud::Spanner.new

all_config_ids = spanner.instance_configs.all.map do |config|
  config.name
end

examples.caption: Limit the number of API calls made:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/spanner"

spanner = Google::Cloud::Spanner.new

spanner.instance_configs.all(request_limit: 10) do |config|
  puts config.name
end

params.name: request_limit
params.description:
The upper limit of API requests to
make to load all configs. Default is no limit.

params.name: yield
params.description: The block for accessing each instance config.
